availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harvey Hall (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Parmelia Thomas Hall on September 19, 1838. Father of Henry T. Hall, Green H. Hall, Marcus L. Hall, Zach T. Hall, Josiah D. Hall, John W. Hall, Henrietta Hall, and Margaret Hall. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 52; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 23; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 2, Subdivision 144, p. 135; Kentucky, County Marriages, 1783-1965, Ancestry, Estill County, 1838. Francis Vincent, ed., Vincentâ€™s Semi-Annual United States Register: A Work in Which the Principal Events of Every Half-Year Occurring in the United States Are Recorded, Each Arranged Under the Day of its Date. This Volume Contains the Events Transpiring Between the 1st of January and 1st of July, 1860 (Philadelphia, PA: Francis Vincent, 1860), p. 243; Find A Grave, "James Harvey Hall (1814-1890)," Memorial #24007598, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=24007598 (accessed August 24, 2017); KYR-0001-029-0545; KYR-0001-004-0463.
